title: Informal serif with triangular dot - Kids
content:
Hi folks,  
I got this sample today, and have had no luck pinning it down. Does anyone recognize the style?

Thanks,  
- Mike

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KidsFont_5126.gif)
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
<cite>Does anyone recognize the style?</cite>

Yes. From [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124540/http:/typophile.com/node/66911). ;-)

Huh. It looks like the person who sent it to me also posted [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124540/http:/typophile.com/node/66911).

Florian, I leave it to you how to handle this.

- Mike Yanega

You were way ahead of me. ;-)

- Mike

Only seconds …  
I’ll keep this thread, because the sample has been adjusted to a reasonable size – thanks. Will delete the other one.

(bump)

Any ideas where to look for this?

- Mike

(bump)

One more try. Any ideas? This sure seems like it would be a font, and it looks professional. It just doesn't seem to be in any category I can use to describe it on MyFonts. (And WTF was no help at all).

- Mike

It has a Fontdiner feel, hasn't it?  
I checked all of dinkTYPE to no avail.  
I found this:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/perfect-magic/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124540/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/perfect-magic/bold/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/perfect-magic/bold/")  
that may or may not feel similar.
